intro: Paronychia kochiana, commonly known as the coastal bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It is a member of the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes various carnivorous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bilaterally symmetric flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shorelines, where it thrives in salty, coastal conditions. Paronychia kochiana is notable for its ability to tolerate high salinity and is often found in maritime environments.
